title: Learner-Centered Language Education Design for Integrating Open Educational Practices (OEP)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language education theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: A process where professionals in medical/legal/technical fields collaboratively create and share OER-based language education materials for elementary learners.

learning_goals: Learners can create three or more language education materials for elementary audiences by applying the OEP 5R Framework (Revise, Retain, Remix, Reuse, Redistribute).
Learners can perform the OER improvement process through peer feedback using a constructivist approach at least twice.
Learners can build an OER sharing platform and execute material distribution at least once using digital collaboration tools in a BYOD environment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
